alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:07AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, Wicomico, Worcester, Dorchester and north central Accomack Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 605 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Denton to near Lexington Park. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Deal Island around 650 AM EDT. Princess Anne and Salisbury around 705 AM EDT. Westover and Marion Station around 715 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Brookview, Trinity, Cokesbury, Eden, Sanford, Longridge, Mount Vernon, Chesapeake Heights, Pittsville and Powellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
